content: H2Onitrogen11812881285938114† CCDC reference numbers 641198–641200. For crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format see DOI: 10.1039/b707579kcrystallographic data‡ Electronic supplementary information (ESI) available: Full NMR spectroscopic and crystallographic data for complexes 1–3. See DOI: 10.1039/b707579kNMRcrystallographic data§ Synthesis of 1: a stirred solution of [(AuCl)2(dppbz)] (1′) (its synthetic procedure can be found in the electronic supplementary information, ESI‡) (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane was treated with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light. The AgCl precipitate was filtered through Celite. Diethyl ether was added to precipitate the complex. The white precipitate was filtered off, washed with dichloromethane and diethyl ether. Yield: 0.2185 g (93.4 %). Diffraction quality single crystals were obtained by slow diffusion of n-hexane into a CH2Cl2 solution of 1; mp 220–226 °C. 1H NMR (399.9 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C): δ 7.22–7.32 (m, 2H), 7.39–7.50 (m, 16H), 7.52–7.56 (m, 4H), 7.56–7.62 (m, 2H). 31P{1H} NMR (161.890 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C): δ 20.1 (s). Synthesis of 2: complex 1 was in situ obtained by reacting 1′ (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light, then was filtered through Celite into a flask containing a solution of 4,4’-bipyridyl (0.034 g, 0.22 mmol) in dichloromethane. After stirring of 5 h, diethyl ether was added to precipitate the complex. The white precipitate was filtered off, washed with dichloromethane and diethyl ether. Yield: 0.444 g (82.75%). Diffraction quality single crystals were obtained by slow diffusion of n-hexane into a mother liquor of 2; mp 162–166 °C. Solid-state 31P{1H} MAS (242.769 MHz, 25 °C, 16 kHz) δ 21.3. Synthesis of 3: complex 1 was in situ obtained by reacting 1′ (0.20 g, 0.22 mmol) in 10 mL dichloromethane with CF3COOAg (0.097 g, 0.44 mmol). The mixture was stirred for 5 h, shielded from light, then was filtered through Celite into a flask containing a solution of 1,2-trans-bis(4-pyridyl)-ethylene (0.04 g, 0.22 mmol) in dichloromethane. After stirring of 5 h, diethyl ether was added to precipitate the complex. The white precipitate was filtered off, washed with dichloromethane and diethyl ether. Yield: 0.445 g (81.2 %). Diffraction quality single crystals were obtained by slow diffusion of n-hexane into dichloromethane solution of 3; mp 150–154 °C. Solution 1H NMR (399.909 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C) δ 7.24-7.33 (m, 2H), 7.39 (s, 2H), 7.41–7.52 (m, 16H), 7.56–7.70 (m, 10H), 8.46–8.53 (d, J = 6.2 Hz, 4H). Solution 31P{1H} NMR (161.890 MHz, CD2Cl2, 25 °C): δ 20.29 (s).
